body_mass_index.title: Body Mass Index (BMI) Calculator
body_mass_index.description: Calculate your BMI and determine if your weight is within the normal range for your height.

messages.what_bmi_is_description: The Body Mass Index (BMI) is a parameter used to assess whether a person's weight is proportionate to their height. To calculate BMI, simply divide the weight in kilograms by the square of the height in meters. This tool is useful for both women and men who want to monitor their health, helping you understand if you are underweight, at a normal weight, or overweight, providing a useful indication of your physical condition.
messages.low_or_high_bmi_risks: Risks of a High or Low BMI
messages.low_or_high_bmi_risks_description: A high or low body mass index can indicate health risks. A BMI above the normal range suggests overweight or obesity, increasing the risk of heart disease, diabetes, and high blood pressure. Conversely, a low BMI may indicate underweight, leading to issues such as weakness, osteoporosis, and nutritional deficiencies. If your BMI is outside the normal parameters, consult a doctor for advice on diet and exercise.

daily_calorie_needs.title: Daily Calorie Needs Calculator
daily_calorie_needs.description: Estimate your daily caloric needs based on physical activity, age, and weight

messages.bmr_description: It is the number of calories your body consumes at rest to maintain vital functions such as breathing and blood circulation. BMR primarily depends on age, sex, weight, and height. There are various formulas to calculate BMR, such as the Harris-Benedict formula.
messages.what_daily_calorie_needs_is_description: Daily calorie needs represent the number of calories your body requires each day to perform all activities, both physical and mental. This value is essential for maintaining a stable body weight and ensuring your body's proper function. The calculation of daily calories takes into account the basal metabolic rate, physical activities, and other factors such as age, sex, and weight.
messages.what_bmr_is_description: Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR) is the number of calories your body consumes at rest to maintain vital functions such as breathing, blood circulation, and body temperature. This value is influenced by factors like age, sex, weight, and height. BMR forms the basis of the daily calorie needs calculation, as it represents the calories needed to survive without doing anything.
messages.purpose_of_knowing_your_daily_calorie_ne: What is the Purpose of Knowing Your Daily Calorie Needs?

Knowing your daily calorie needs is essential for managing weight and health. Understanding how many calories your body requires allows you to set an appropriate diet, avoiding both overweight and excessive weight loss. Additionally, it helps you determine how much to eat to maintain, gain, or reduce weight in a healthy and balanced way. This calculation is particularly useful for those looking to improve their fitness or who have specific goals such as building muscle mass or losing weight.
messages.how_to_calculate_your_daily_calorie_need: How to Calculate Your Daily Calorie Needs (and Basal Metabolic Rate)

how_to_calculate_your_daily_calorie_need.intro: To calculate your daily calorie needs, you need to start with your Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR) using, for example, the Harris-Benedict formula. The formula varies slightly between men and women:
how_to_calculate_your_daily_calorie_need.men_formula: BMR = 66.473 + (13.7516 × weight in kg) + (5.0033 × height in cm) - (6.755 × age in years)
how_to_calculate_your_daily_calorie_need.women_formula: BMR = 655.0955 + (9.5634 × weight in kg) + (1.8496 × height in cm) - (4.6756 × age in years)
how_to_calculate_your_daily_calorie_need.after_bmr_formula: Once the BMR is calculated, multiply it by a physical activity factor:

messages.why_is_it_important_to_know_your_daily_c: Why is it Important to Know Your Daily Calorie Needs?

Knowing your daily calorie needs is crucial for maintaining a healthy lifestyle. It helps you make informed dietary decisions, maintain or reach your desired weight, and improve your overall health. Understanding how many calories your body needs allows you to properly balance caloric intake with energy expenditure, avoiding the risk of gaining weight or losing weight in an unhealthy way.

food_waste.title: Food Waste Calculator
food_waste.description: Analyze CO2 emissions and average cost for different food categories, helping you make more sustainable and informed decisions.

messages.wasted_amount_cant_be_greater_than_bough: Wasted amount cant be greater than bought amount
messages.calculation_results: Out of ~{total_emissions} CO₂eq emitted, ~{wasted_emissions} CO₂eq were wasted. Only ~{could_have_been_enough_emissions} CO₂eq would have been enough.{break}Out of ~{total_costs}€ spent, ~{wasted_costs}€ were wasted. Only ~{could_have_been_enough_costs}€ would have been enough.
messages.sources_on_carbon_footprint_and_prices: Sources on carbon footprint and prices
messages.how_food_waste_gets_calculated_descripti: Calculating food waste is crucial for understanding the impact of our eating habits on the environment and our wallets. Our tool estimates your carbon footprint based on the amount of food wasted and the information you provide, calculating the equivalent in CO₂ emissions to give a clear picture of how much we waste and how we can improve.
messages.how_to_reduce_food_waste_description: Reducing food waste is possible by adopting simple measures. Plan your weekly meals, create a targeted shopping list, and store food properly. Learn to recycle leftovers and monitor expiration dates. Even smaller portions can make a difference, preventing you from cooking or serving more than necessary.
messages.how_to_reduce_carbon_footprint_of_our_di: How to reduce the carbon footprint of our diet

Reducing the carbon footprint of our diet starts with conscious choices. Opt for local and seasonal foods, reduce meat and fish consumption, and choose products with less packaging. A food carbon footprint calculator can help you visualize the impact of your food choices, allowing you to adopt more sustainable habits.
